##### 4.2.1.5 AccessControl (M)

> **Section ID**: 4.2.1.5 | **Page**: 38-46

Table 22 contains Optional rows identified by (O).
Notation:
*AC1:  the notation of ‚ÄúTT TT TT TT‚Äù represents a shorthand for the LSBs of the Table object UIDs
*AC2:  the notation of ‚ÄúTT TT TT TT‚Äù represents a shorthand for the LSBs of the SPTemplates object UIDs
*AC3:  the notation of ‚ÄúTT TT TT TT‚Äù represents a shorthand for the LSBs of the MethodID object UIDs
*AC4:  the notation of ‚ÄúTT TT TT TT‚Äù represents a shorthand for the LSBs of the ACE object UIDs
*AC5:  the notation of ‚ÄúTT TT TT TT‚Äù represents a shorthand for the LSBs of the Authority object UIDs
*AC6:  the notation of ‚ÄúTT TT TT TT‚Äù represents a shorthand for the LSBs of the Template object UIDs
*AC7:  the notation of ‚ÄúTT TT TT TT‚Äù represents a shorthand for the LSBs of the SP object UIDs
*AC8:  refer to section 5.1.2 for details on the requirements for supporting Revert
*AC9:  refer to section 5.1.1 for details on the requirements for supporting Activate
The InvokingID, MethodID and GetACLACL columns are a special case. Although they are marked as Read-Only
with fixed access control, the access control for invocation of the Get method is (N).
The ACL column is readable only via the GetACL method.
